snippet: The league receives global exposure through such play but gets few tangible benefits, and team owners worry about injuries to players they have invested a lot of money in.
abstract: Severity of injury to Indiana Pacers forward Paul George, who fractured bones in his lower right leg during USA Basketball training camp scrimmage, has sent jolt through NBA, intensifying discussion about the value of NBA players’ participation in off-season international basketball competitions.
lead_paragraph: The league receives global exposure through such play but gets few tangible benefits, and team owners worry about injuries to players they have invested a lot of money in.

headline.main: Paul George’s Injury Fuels Concerns in N.B.A. Over International Competition
headline.print_headline: Injury to Pacers’ George Fuels Concerns in N.B.A. Over International Play
